title: Turrets are never useful when you need them to be
body:
I play a lot of top lane, and I think it's quite ridiculous how I can take a turret shot on purpose by just walking into the turret range, and only lose like 100 health. There arent as many tower dive fails this season as there used to be, because fail tower diving is actually very hard to do.
you have a buddy with you, you are guaranteed a kill unless you're both imbeciles.
dont even get me started on the turret's health. i cant tp to other lanes anymore unless I want to risk losing my tower.
singed is actually a strong split pusher because the minions do so much damage to the useless shit. since they have no enemy minions to attack, they are just going to attack the tower, and destroy it very quickly.
every match of lcs I see, the jungler and bot lane always take a tower before first blood is drawn. it's ridiculous how weak these damn things are.

give us fortify back. at the very least on an item active. if ohmwrecker used on allied turrets would allow us to buff the damn things for at least a couple seconds, the item would actually be useful for something.

also, increase the turret range enough so ranged champions cant just poke you under your own turret without risk of getting hit.
I've suggested this one for a while now, and I approve.

Towers are supposed to provide a safety net for teams and players that fall behind. Instead, players/teams that get ahead can completely ignore towers because of how League of Mobility has allowed champions to go in, get a kill, and get out without any punishment whatsoever. What's the point of even having towers? At this point they're basically just oversized pink wards that reduce the cooldown of your teleport.

I feel pretty similar that they often don't feel strong enough against dive, especially in the early game, but their regulation of minion waves and early pushers functions pretty well, since, especially in solo queue, it doesn't feel like people that push the wave are able to knock turrets over in the first 5 minutes without some kind of explicit team strategy.

As to the tower diving case, I wonder how jarring it would be if they would, as you say, have enough oomph to kill someone on the third/fourth hit. It would certainly reduce the power of dives, but it might also really discourage _some_ good aggressive action, potentially stalling out games. I will say that if turrets had more firepower to them against champions, it would probably really increase the value of late game champs that are just trying to survive the lane.

Turrets are bad for all the wrong reasons, imo. They feel really weak really quickly, and even when a team pushes a single lane heavily the inhibitor turrets don't feel spectacular. At the same time, just buffing them numerically would likely just stretch out games, which would be far worse overall. The bonus effects added during the Summoner's Rift overhaul also mostly either shrunk to really weak levels (e.g. tier 2 turrets and their personal shield) or just disappeared completely (e.g. beam turrets having a slow and damage reduction effect). Beyond that, I think there's also a serious issue with turrets discouraging melee champions from pushing as part of a team, due to how they end up being exposed, which just encourages top laners to splitpush even more when the rest of the team is grouping, and is likely one of the reasons why marksmen are such a fixture in every game (nobody else can push turrets with the same level of speed and consistency). On top of this, turrets don't feel particularly valuable, again because they quickly lose their threat, which is why items specifically designed to interact with them in some way (e.g. {{item:2053}}, {{item:3056}}, {{item:3512}}) aren't nearly as popular as they deserve to be.

Farther down, I think Riot should attempt to do a few crazier experiments with turrets, minions and lanes in general. Black Market Brawlers was a great experiment in making minions more interesting, and while brawlers might be a bit too complicated in the long run, I think there's a lot of stuff that could be put in place via both minions and turrets to make lanes and their structures feel more powerful and interesting without jeopardizing the game's pace or clarity. One thing worth trying, for example, would be to have turrets spawn minions at their feet, rather than the nexus, which would eliminate proxy farming, and another potential experiment could be to give one type of turret an additional shot per enemy champion in range, which would discourage ganging up on lone champions under their tower. Perhaps some turrets could just not fire any shots at all, and instead have other effects that would influence laning and champion interaction.

they should make true damage or % max hp damage

> **Arcane Oil Can**
{{item:1006}} + 270G = 450G
+50% Health Regeneration per 5 Seconds
Passive- Refill: Refills upon visiting your team's fountain. Can only contain 1 charge. The passive health regeneration is halved once all charges are used.
Active- Arcane Oil: The closest tower, for 7.5 seconds, takes 35% reduced damage, deals 15% increased damage, shoots 35% faster, and can shoot at every enemy champion underneath it's range that has attacked an allied champion. The tower also ignores untargetability for the duration. The tower cannot have Arcane Oil reapplied to it for 3.5 seconds after the effect ends. (40 second cool down) (Requires 1 charge)
_Only one Arcane Oil Can can be purchased per champion._

This would be an early game item that could be bought if the enemy is extremely dive heavy and maybe even poke heavy. Use it and for 7.5 seconds your tower is empowered to help you deal with that Riven and roaming Zed that keep diving you. It has a 40 second cool down so it can't be purchased late game to make your Nexus Towers the toughest things ever continuously by constantly going to fountain and reapplying the buff to your towers.

This way the defending champion has to use gold to have a stronger tower and can only do so once per return to the lane. It also gives an interesting space where the enemy champion could make the target wiff a can to waste the charge. Then their jungler could come in and tower dive. It can also can't be purchased as a starter item since you can't get any pots with it. If you bought it first, it would be a real sacrafise to lane sustain.
Instead of limiting it to 1 per champion, just make the passive/active unique. That's the point of unique passives/actives. This is a cool idea, but I think it might do better with a higher price.

they took power away from the bullet turrets and invested it entirely into the lazer turrets. 

.................them lasers op

Perhaps a buff that increases tower damage based on the towers own missing heath? Could either make it shoot faster or just up the damage, might give riot another lever on towers. Also gives enemy team counter-play options. 

Do we want to try to take down the tower, or do we want to tower dive for kills? Obviously they can tower dive then take it, but it might be better than now. 
Also could be a buff that only applies when enemy champions are near which would reduce the frequency of people killing towers in one minion wave, while not causing overly crazy side effects to how minion waves push on their own.
They could also opt to make it a stacking buff based on how many enemy champions are near. 

From there I'd imagine it'd be a numbers game.

I don't know if it or any of the ideas anyone's listed would fix it, but i definitely agree that towers frequently feel like they are under-powered or at times completely worthless.

Another issue with turrets is that against AD laners you can build armor to help you dive/tank turret damage, however if you're against a magic damage oriented enemy you can't dive them by building MR generally.

So a split way to make armor stacking not so effective against turrets and to give MR increased value I would suggest turrets damage be split roughly 60/40 physical and magic damage.

It's by design. Meddler recently said that towers are weak intentionally because they fear that no one will be able to end games if towers are good. This is what's led to no one ever buying 'tower counters' like BoC, Portal and Ohmwrecker because there's no point wasting an item slot on an item that isn't needed to kill towers.

The real issue of course is that towers completely lack gameplay. They have simplistic AI that shoots a single bolt at enemies. They need be more threatening in a gameplay point of view like every 3rd shot does AoE damage or something (i'd do a proper brainstorm but too tired atm) and their targeting AI needs to be overhauled, far too often I get tower dived and after the whole ordeal (where i'm dead ofc) the tower is still shooting flipping minions. Tanks also shouldn't be able to just ignore towers (except ult'd Alistair, I would view that as his strategic niche) but they can because they do no damage.

If this was fixed up then towers would be powerful, but wouldn't that mean teams can't end games because people could stall under their tower? Well that would be the case if there were no options to play against towers, fortunately we *already* have 3 already mentioned items that would be ripe for use against these newly empowered turrets (with more possibilities i'm sure). Furthermore you could even add new items/summoner spells for DEFENDING your turret. Imagine Garrison on SR, it'd be great.

tl;dr

Towers are weak by design so teams can end games. Imo they should be reworked to be powerful/can't be ignored and useful in defense but have items and summoner's spells (some of which already exist) that can be used to help with or against sieges/tower dives.

There are a lot of options to try that could be cool.

Turret firing rate increases by 25% per nearby enemy, on hit stacking damage reduction (that way the more Yi auto attacks the harder the turret is to kill), or dealing mixed damage.
